amendment.description: Amendment, as offered, requires TSA to establish protocols for identity verification of individuals who travel with known air traveler credentials. As modified, (text appears on page H6199 of the Congressional Record) the amendment provides for alternative screening procedures for individuals with top security clearances including random, risk-based screening determined to be necessary to respond to a specific threat to security.
amendment.purpose: An amendment numbered 3 printed in House Report 111-127 to require the Assistant Secretary to establish a `known air traveler cred ential' that incorporates biometric identifier technology.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Mica amendment (A003) as modified Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Mica amendment (A003) modified by unanimous consent. The modification to the amendment requires the Assistant Secretary to verify the identify of U.S. citizens who participate in the Registered Traveler program not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of this Act.
House amendment offered/reported by : Amendment (A003) offered by Mr. Mica.
House amendment agreed to: On agreeing to the Mica amendment (A003) as modified Agreed to by voice vote.
Amendment agreed to Committee of the Whole
